column1: back of a length on leg stump, he got into position to pull, but was too early into the shot and wears it on the thigh pad. Went off a bottom edge in fact

run out chance missed at the bowler's end!. Length ball on off, Rohit pushed it to short mid-off. Extra cover sprinted in and under-armed a throw, and Rohit had initially taken a few steps down. Rahul responded but was sent back. Had to dive. Would have been out with a direct hit
left alone, well clear of off slanting across him
angling across him, left alone
hint of shape into him, on the stumps on a length, Rohit gets behind it and defends solidly
sticking in the pitch a bit, is the ball. On a length again, Rohit wants to punch on the up, but doesn't get the timing right and it trickles to mid-off. Maiden over
good length outside off, shaping away from him. Left alone
the slips won't help if you bowl short and wide outside off. Rahul transfers weight back and cuts it beautifully through point
better length, fuller than the last one and keeps it very wide of off. Rahul's not getting near it
angles this into him, but Rahul is poised and tucks it off his thigh pad through midwicket
back of a length and jagging back into him, bounced a bit higher than expected too. Rohit misses the tuck and is struck high on the thigh pad
good length in the channel, hint of inward movement, pushed towards silly point.
length ball angling across him, left alone
goes slightly fuller and keeps it stump to stump, gently defended into the offside from the crease
length ball on leg stump this time, Rahul shuffles across and tucks it to backward square leg
fuller on off, drives on the front foot but can't beat cover
length ball on the stumps, steered to point
fuller on the stumps, flicked away but straight to midwicket. Two maidens in a row for Cottrell
Great line and length, homing in on the channel, but Rohit's happy to let it go through
length ball seaming back into him, beats  the inside edge onto pad, with Rohit pushing at it

he's taken his time to get off the mark but does so in style. Walks down the track, takes it on the half-volley outside off and unfurls a peach of a cover drive. Spotted the length early - Holder's been keeping it fuller this over too.
too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that
strays on the pad again, and is tucked with soft hands to short fine leg
jagging into him again off a length, and hits his thigh pad, with Rahul not connecting while trying to tuck it
fuller on the stumps, clipped to mid-on
fuller on off, stays beside it, transfers weight a bit forward and pushes it to point. Was a slower one by Cottrell, off-cutter
length ball on off, patted into the offside
length outside off, Rohit stands up and wants to slap this through the ring field, but gets it off the bottom half of the bat
full on off, another slower one. Rolled his fingers to off-cut it. Steered to point
normal pace ball, full on the stumps, pushed firmly to the bowler's left, beat's mid-off
and Rohit has had enough of hanging about and gently driving cutters. This was marginally short, he just rocks back and thwacks a pull shot into the vacant wide long-on area.

back of a length outside off, Rahul rises up to defend it near his mid-riff, gets a thick outside edge that goes past slip. Point sprints across and lets loose a throw, but the batsmen are home after a moment of hesitation
length angling in on off, defended with a straight bat
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and gently defends
length ball coming into him on off, defended to extra cover
too full on the pads, flicked off his toes to mid-on's right but he moves quickly to cut it off
back of a length on the fifth stump, and he gets that to bounce a bit more too. Rahul thought about slashing it but dropped his hands in time to let it go through
length outside off, glides it to third man with a horizontal bat
extravagant movement while angling it across, ends up well wide of off.

out comes the Cottrell salute. Back of a length on leg stump, tucks Rahul up a bit. He was looking to flick it, but is a mite early into the shot, and the ball takes the leading edge to lob straight up and settle into Hetmyer's hands at short mid-on.
good length and tight line on the fourth stump, he lets it go
fuller nibbling around off stump, pushed off the front foot towards mid-off
imperiously driven to long-off to get off the mark. Too full and on a driving length, he just leans into it

castled him! What a huge moment in the match this. Cottrell has two in the over, but the second one is Kohli. Rolled his fingers over it, back of a length outside off, Kohli was looking to open the face and run it down, but it takes the inside edge and clatters into stumps.
length angling into him, tucked to midwicket
inside edge onto pad, would have been plumb otherwise. Holder floated this up much fuller, and Rohit was a bit late in getting his bat down to defend, got an inside edge onto pad
sharp movement, making the keeper dive to his left to collect. Length ball outside off, he leaves it alone and it comes in a long way
fuller on off, defended down the pitch

inside edge goes for four. India would have been in real trouble there, but get away by inches. Similar shot to Kohli, length ball outside off, Rohit plays it without moving his feet and the bat comes down at an angle a bit, gets the inside edge and rolls past the stumps
much more solid in defence that time, comes on the front foot with bat and pad close together
length ball on off, steered to point
slower ball, fuller outside off, he has to wait a bit while going to drive, ends up gently patting it to cover
fuller on the stumps again, defended carefully into the offside
back of a length, normal pace this time, tapped back down the pitch
fuller on off, pushed off the front foot to the bowler's left
fuller on leg stump, turned to square leg. Third maiden for Cottrell in five overs so far
length ball coming into him, defended from the crease towards cover
slightly shorter, Rohit stays in his crease, transfers weight back and punches, but can't beat cover
back of a length outside off, tries to punch it through the offside ring but isn't getting the timing or the placement right
length in the channel, pushed back off the front foot. Takes the inside half of the bat to midwicket
regal. Goes for the yorker, but ends up as a half volley on leg stump, and Rohit just moves his leg out of the way slightly and punch-drives it straight back
length outside off, defended to cover
great shot. Drops it a bit short outside off and turning further away, and Iyer rocks back to to cut this through backward point
still a little short, though straighter now, and Iyer goes back whips this through midwicket
too full this time, outside off, leans into the push to cover
quicker, but drags it shorter and on leg stump, uses his wrists to work it through square leg
fuller on off, comes on the front foot to steer it to point
tossed up on off, opens the face to guide it to point, coming on the front foot
back of a length in the channel, jabs it to point
tailing into him and takes the pad to fine leg. Holder's appealing but that was sliding down leg
full on the stumps, defended solidly on the front foot
fuller on the pads ,flicked to fine leg

Uppish but gets it past the bowler. Full on the stumps, he brings his bat down straight to drive. Rohit has to take evasive action and Holder's long arms just a millimetre short of taking the ball, with right hand stretched out.
length outside off, left alone
that's a full toss that everyone has missed! tossed up invitingly for Rohit to have a thrash at it, but he misses. It lands almost yorker length for the keeper and goes through his legs
fuller length, pushed to cover
drifts down leg and dips, beats his sweep and hits the pad. The bowler appeals but that was easily down leg. Might have pitched and had impact outside too
beaten. tossed up, drawing him on the front foot to drive, dips and turns past the bat
tossed up outside off again and this time Rohit gets lower and uses wrists to slap this through backward point. No one there so he gets a boundary
beaten again with the tossed up ball outside off that Rohit is stretching out for, but which whizzes past his edge
off-cutter to start with, back of a length outside off, cuts through point
length on off, defended carefully back

drags it down short, Rohit's eyes lit up and he went for an almighty pull, looking to send the ball to downtown Chennai, but he gets it off the bottom end of the edge of the bat and it bounces to the keeper
plays it with bat close to body and more softly this time, allowing a length ball to come on to him and gliding it to third man
shot. Back of a length outside off, and punched with great timing through cover. There is protection in the deep via a sweeper though
goes fuller that time outside off, he lunges out and steers this into the offside
dismissed with power. Another full toss first ball, and Rohit sweeps it hard and true through square leg, picking the gap in the field to collect a boundary
fuller on off, driven to long-off
length ball outside off, turning away, steered to point
edge flies through vacant slip. Good length, gets it to bounce a lot more than expected. Iyer slashes hard and gets a top edge that goes fine and gives him a boundary
length on the stumps this time, goes right back and defends it
full on off, driven on the front foot to long-off
back of a length on the fourth stump, stays beside it and punches to point
stands tall and punches this to point's right
that was a slower bouncer that would have been slow for a spinner!. Bangs it halfway down and Rohit has to wait and wait and wait for it, before he pulls it to short fine leg
fuller outside off, lashes it with a horizontal bat to long-on
fuller and wider outside off, he slashes it past backward point. Was in the air but clear of the man
back of a length outside off, and cuts it powerfully through cover-point
back of a length, close to off stump. Gets up on his toes and lets the ball come onto him before defending into the backward point region
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, tucked away to deep square leg
back of a length on middle stump, worked to deep square leg to bring up the 50 partnership
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump. Wants to dab to third man, initially, but the angle cramps him up and he defends to point instead
length ball spinning from off to middle, gets forward to clip into the square leg region
nicely flighted outside off, makes Iyer stretch out to defend back to the bowler
flatter, on the pads, clipped to the right of deep midwicket
looks to step out but Chase gets this one, flighted outside off, to dip a little. Adjusts to defend with the turn into the on side
flatter, on middle and off, goes deep in his crease to work it through square leg
back of a length, spins in towards middle stump, clipped to the left of short fine leg

gone, against the run of play. Short ball, getting up to chest height, and the pull was on, and Rohit plays that shot as well as anyone, but this time he hits it straight to midwicket, at chest height. May have skidded on to him and cramped him for room a little
length ball slanting across towards off stump, gets half forward to defend and the ball rolls towards square leg off the inside half of the bat
full outside off, driven firmly and extra-cover dives left to cut it off
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to backward point
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball pitching on the stumps and turning past leg. Looks to step across and paddle it, and can't put bat to ball
flat length ball on off stump, dabbed towards point
a bit fuller, draws Iyer forward for a push to cover
back of a length, turning in towards off stump, goes deep in his crease and punches to long-on
flat, angling in towards off stump, goes back and punches to long-on to get off the mark
flat, back of a length, outside off. Lets it come on and dabs to the left of short third man
length ball, looks like an offcutter on middle stump, shows the full face to push to the right of mid-on
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
short ball climbing up towards Pant's chest. Lets it come on and uses soft hands to tuck it behind square
fullish, close to off stump, gets forward to punch to mid-off
back of a length, angling into leg stump, hops across and tucks it to long leg

shortish, angling away from off stump, stops on Pant slightly. Wants to slap that into the gap between backward point and cover, but the lack of pace forces him to hit it close enough to the latter fielder to cut it off with a dive to his right
back of a length, turning in towards off stump, goes back and across and works it to square leg
tossed up on middle stump, clipped to square leg
flat, back of a length, close to off stump. Punched firmly but Ambris dives right at short extra-cover to cut it off
back of a length, on off and middle, goes back to punch to long-on
tossed up wide of off, nice use of the hands to drive that to deep point
flat offbreak on middle and off, looks to go back and pull, but the ball stops on him and he checks his shot - ends up hitting it uppishly, and the ball drops a few feet in front of square leg

ooh, again the slowness of the pitch comes into play. Pretty full, pitching on off and angling further across. Not full enough to drive, though, and Pant, reaching for the ball, hits it uppishly to mid-off. There was no single on offer, but Chase gives away an overthrow with a needless throw to the unguarded bowler's end
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed to backward point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and just lets it hit his bat - a la Kane Williamson - and the ball dribbles away into the gully region
length ball on off stump, gets forward for a checked drive to mid-off
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
ooh, misread the length there. Wasn't short enough to cut, and the ball, slanting across into the corridor outside off, whizzes past his bat as he tries to bring it down hurriedly
flat, back of a length, spinning back towards off stump. Punched firmly back to the bowler
tossed up slow on off stump and Iyer shuffles out and clips to long-on

back of a length, spins from middle to off, goes back and across and works it into the backward square leg region. Iyer responds immediately to the call for one, and they make it safely despite the short fine leg fielder moving quickly to his right
tossed up on a good length close to off stump, defended into the covers
just a touch short, just a touch wide, and Iyer jumps back in a flash to cut fiercely behind backward point
back of a length, spins in towards off stump, worked with the turn to square leg
overpitched, close to off stump. Cover point is right on the edge of the circle, and he throws himself into a sprawling dive to his right to stop Pant's drive
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed away to third man
length ball slanting across to off stump, clipped away neatly through square leg to bring up India's 100
full on middle and off, and that's lovely use of the wrists from Pant to flick it away to the left of midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended into the extra-cover region
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
sees Iyer looking to step out and fires it in shorter, at his pads. Clipped to the left of the diving square leg fielder
angles this into the pads, and Pant clips to the fielder at backward square leg
slower now, length ball straightening towards off stump. Gets on the front foot and defends towards the non-striler
shortish on off stump, and Pant collapses his back knee to create a little more shortness of length and pulls it away flat to the left of midwicket
slides on with the angle, clipped to short midwicket
slower, angling down leg. Looks to sweep but can't beat short fine leg
shortish, fourth-stump line, gets across to tuck it gently into the square leg region
length ball angling into off stump, gets forward to block it back to the bowler
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
fullish outside off, punched to extra-cover
length ball sliding down leg. Aims a big whip at the ball but can't make contact
angles this one into the pads and Pant whips it away to the left of deep square leg

slower ball, full and wide outside off. Quite deliberate, an attempt to get Pant to hit in the air to wide long-off - he got out playing a similar shot off a similar line in the third T20I - but he controls the shot well and the ball bounces well in front of the fielder
nicely flighted, spins from middle to off, gets forward to block to the bowler
shot. A bit of flight again, but it's fuller, and Pant can reach out and hoist a big slog-sweep into the stands beyond the midwicket boundary
short, a bit of width, slapped to deep point
length ball spinning in towards middle and off. Stays back and looks to clip into the leg side, ends up playing it back to the bowler off the leading edge
flatter, a little wider outside off, chopped to backward point
flat again, spins into the stumps, goes deep in his crease to work it through midwicket
back of a length outside off, steered to third man

fullish, angling in from wide of the crease. Looks to step forward and across and work it into the leg side, and misses. Lbw appeal from the bowler but the impact was well outside the line of off stump
slower ball, wanted to bowl that wide line to draw the uppish drive from Pant, but he ends up slipping it much, much wider than intended, towards the very edge of the pitch. Left alone
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to deep midwicket
shot. He's really good in that area. Back of a length outside off, uses a slicing motion of his hands to steer the ball behind point, and to the right of third man
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
length ball on off stump, gets forward and meets this with a straight bat to push to the right of midwicket
fullish, wide outside off - that line and length again - and Pant goes for the big drive and gets a thick outside edge down to third man. Brings up the 50 partnership
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended into the on side
back of a length, fifth-stump line, punched to deep point
length ball angling in towards middle stump, clipped quietly to the left of midwicket
length ball wide of off, opens his bat face and steers to third man

shot. Not too many can play this shot, but Pant can, and does it very well. Length ball angling into off stump, and he gets his front leg across and sweeps up and over, to the backward square leg boundary
length ball close to off stump, punched to the sweeper at deep cover point
short, on off stump, pulled along the ground to deep square leg
shortish, not too much width. Chopped to the right of backward point
whoopsie. High full-toss, angling into off stump. Gets up around chest height, and Pant drops his bottom hand off the handle and dabs to backward point
slower ball wide of off stump, and it's called wide after Pant shapes to reverse-scoop, then reverse-slog, and misses
full, angling down leg  and Pant helicopters a leg glance down to the fine leg boundary
slower short ball angling down leg. Looks to swivel into a pull, ends up a little early on the shot and the ball drops down into the ground off his glove
back of a length, angling down leg, tucked to short fine leg
full outside off, he plants his front foot out and drives imperiously through the line. Good work by Pooran at the extra cover boundary, diving and stopping the ball before it rolls over the boundary
back of a length, angling across, left alone
length outside off, runs it down to third man off a thick edge
good length nibbling outside off, he drops it down with soft hands and takes a quick single as it rolls towards slip. Fifty for Iyer and it's also a no-ball

has the license to throw his bat at it and does so with good placement. Full on the stumps, he lofts it straight over the bowler. Not quite as well timed as he would have liked, so it goes for a one bounce four
skilfully done by Pant. Length outside off, he waits for it and late cuts it fine, past a diving keeper
length on the stumps but straying on the pads, tucked backward of square
fuller outside off, square driven to point
length on leg stump, tucked to deep square leg
digs it short into the pitch, Pant waits for it and pulls it with control to square leg. First ODI fifty for Pant and what a fine innings it's been too
loses his radar with the slower ball, too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that. Was the leg-cutter
normal pace this time but still down leg. Another wide
fuller on the stumps, worked to square leg off the front foot
pushed to point
fuller length on the stumps, clipped to wide long-on
up, up and over. Tossed up, too full, and Iyer plays with the turn, a big confident stride out, picks it up off his toes and swings it high and handsome over midwicket
overcompensates by dragging it too short, and Iyer's waiting for it, rocks back and pulls hard to deep square leg. Pooran runs across and dives to save the boundary
length outside off, better areas from Chase. Iyer comes on the front foot and drives to mid-off
the bowler saw him skipping down the track and fired it into his pads while pulling the length back. Iyer adjusts and uses wrists to clip it in front of square
gets some drift into the leftie and then turn away, Pant misses the flick and it rolls to short fine off his pad
smoked. Pant times his skip down the track well, not giving Chase time to adjust his length, gets to the pitch and drives it flat and hard and straight. Into the boundary
low full toss, was probably an attempted yorker, flicked to square leg

nicely picked off to raise a century stand. Cottrell drags it down too short on leg stump, and Iyer stays in his crease, swivels and places the pull perfectly to beat short fine leg and collect a boundary. Was nicely balanced at the crease
play and a miss. Length ball angling across him outside off, tries to cut, but it's too close to the body.
full toss on the pads, flicked to deep square leg. He'll feel he has missed out there, a boundary for the taking possibly
bangs it in short on off stump, and Pant controls his pull shot to deep square leg, keeping it down
length outside off, he stays still, transfers weight back and punches crisply through cover
slower ball, almost yorker length on off stump, clipped back to the bowler off the toe end
length on the stumps, stays in his crease and punches to long-on

dropped by Cottrell at cover. Easy chance. Full outside off, Pant didn't quite get underneath it, launching into a cover drive. Straight to Cottrell, who cups it in front of his face and sees it pop out.
brilliant by Hayden Walsh at point. Pant slashed this backward of point, but Walsh ran and dived full length to his right to stop the ball
now Pant goes to Walsh's left, stays still and slaps this with good timing through cover. Keemo Paul has just about managed to slide and push the ball back at the boundary
length on the stumps, going across him, comes on the front foot and taps it down towards square leg for a quick single
too full and too wide outside off. The intention is right, but it's beyond the tramlines and he'll have to rebowl it
keeps it full but on the sixth stump this time, Pant goes across and biffs a drive to long-off
back of a length outside off, slapped to long-on with a horizontal bat
too wide outside off again. Another wide
yorker on the fourth stump, digs it out to long-off

flicked straight to Pollard at midwicket. Completely against the run of play. Back of a length outside off, and perhaps it stuck in the pitch a bit. Iyer flicked but didn't get his shape perfectly, and pops a dolly of a catch to one of the safest fielders in the world. End of a fine innings
bouncer outside off first up, Jadhav drops his hands and lets it go through
length outside off, dabbed it through backward point
slower ball, length on off, pats it down the pitch
length outside of, he shuffles across and tucks it backward of square
fuller outside off, driven with the full face of the bat. Mid-off fields
pace off again, length on the stumps, tapped towards leg gully
nicely deflected to third man. Back of a length in the channel, and he runs it down delicately
fuller outside off, driven to deep cover on the front foot
good line and well bowled. Keeps it inside the tramline, but wide enough for Pant to abandon thoughts of reaching for it and he lets it go
this time he brings it much closer, on a fifth stump line, but yorker length. Bowled at 141 kph, and Pant is late into the drive, misses it
full and straight once again, but a touch too full, and Pant drives it to long-off
bangs it in shorter, but doesn't rise as much. Jadhav pulls to deep square leg
yorker length on the fourth stump, driven to long-off
length outside off, he waits for it and runs it down to third man by opening the bat face
back of a length, punched to long on, off the back foot

through Pooran's legs at midwicket. Bad ball, dragged too short and Pant smashes a pull into the ground, hit quite hard. Pooran was set to gather it but perhaps got bad bounce and the ball goes through

lovely placement. Full outside off, Pant takes a stride out and drives powerfully through cover. The man in the field can't get to it on his right. The man on the boundary can't run around and stop it to his left

flicked straight to deep square leg. Offcutter on a fuller length, Pant went down and flicked it powerfully, almost Kohli-like, generating distance and power, but not quite enough, as he picks out the man in the deep. End of a very good innings
smacked. Too short and Pollard doesn't have the pace to hurry the batsman, it sits up and Jadhav gets into position early, back and across and unleashes a fierce pull over deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, mis-times the cut to backward point
length ball going across him on off, and turns into him, cuts it for a single
length ball on the stumps, fizzing away, jabbed towards point
too short and Jadhav goes back and across again and pulls to deep midwicket
good length outside off, he comes on the front foot and guides it with the turn through silly point
stretches forward and steers this to short third man
full, going across him, driven on the front foot but cover intercepts
pace off again, fuller on the stumps, has to wait for it and clip through midwicket
off-cutter on a length, tucked through square off his pads
good length on off, tapped softly into the midwicket region. They think about two but fielders swoop in quickly to keep them to one
fuller, angling across him, driven to cover
skilfully done. Off-cutter on leg stump, Jadeja comes on the front foot and turns it gently off his pad, very, very fine, to get a boundary
fuller outside off, stroked to point. Jadeja wants a single, Jadhav sends him back. Rightly so, there was no run there
slapped through point
fuller outside off, driven to long-off
length ball on the leg stump and turning across, he stays back and tucks it square

hesitation in running leads to a wild throw and an extra run. This was pushed to point from close to his body. Jadeja was sauntering down Jadhav responded late, having not realised a single was on. The fielder at point saw that, and threw it quickly but over the keeper
a touch short, pulled to midwicket
short, well outside off, cuts to deep point
bit of swing into him, and he's late on that, trying to clip it square. Takes a leading edge that rolls along the ground towards cover
down the track and giving himself room, but he bowls it a bit shorter and follows the batsman, who can only hack it away towards midwicket
full on off, jabbed towards extra cover
smartly done. full toss on the pads, with Jadhav moving away to create room and the bowler following him. But he adjusts and sweeps it over short fine leg
way down legside and that'll have to be rebowled
shot!. Short and wide outside off, and he had no protection deep and square, so Jadhav cuts it over the in-field
good length on the stumps, patted back down the pitch
back of a length, tucking him up, punched to cover
fuller on off, flicked to midwicket
length ball, nipping back in, misses the flick and the ball rolls off pad
was giving himself room but the bowler followed, spearing it in full and Jadeja misses connecting again. hits the pad and goes towards cover
moving across to try and ramp it, but doesn't get it in the right slot and can only paddle it to short fine leg
was giving himself room again, backed away a long way but the bowler followed, not letting him free his arms. Punches to long-on from the inside half of his bat
full on the stumps, slogs across the line but doesn't get hold of it and it rolls to deep midwicket
full on the pads, whips it with his wrists between long-on and deep midwicket

late swing into the batsman, who is trying to almost helicopter it away, but misses. Thuds into pad and Joseph's appealing - bad idea because it was easily going down leg and it also gives the batsman the space to steal a leg-bye
yorker on leg stump, he gives himself room but it's too close to his body to do anything much and he can only hoick it to long-on
giving himself room again, Joseph keeps it full and straight on the stumps, and the batsman slaps it down to long-off
this time he didn't give himself room, though made as if he would. Joseph bowled it full and just outside leg, but with Jadeja staying put, he was in ideal positoin to flick it past short fine leg
backs away and slashes it through the vacant slip area. No fielder that fine on the boundary also, so he'll get four
fuller and quicker, on the fifth stump. He tried to whip a drive in front of square but misses it
pace off again, leg-cutter coming into him, he waits for it and flicks it with soft hands through midwicket. Jadeja pushes hard for the second and they get it
fuller, speared into him, defended to cover for a single
pace off, length ball outside off, Jadeja flicks to midwicket. He wants two again, but Jadhav says no early. Might have been two if he had pushed hard. He meaning Jadhav.
yorker length tailing into him, inside edges onto pad
digs it in short, outside off, Jadeja pulls it through midwicket
superb slower bouncer, made Jadhav wait for it for an eternity. He was finally not able to connect trying to slash it away outside off
length ball angled across him, he horribly mis-times his swipe, and it lobs up to Pollard at long-on, who holds on easily

fuller on the stumps, jams his bat down in time to send it to midwicket. Quick single taken, safe despite the fielder running in and effecting a direct hit at the striker's end. wait a minute, replays show Jadeja was out of the crease! The umpire didn't go upstairs though. And now they're going up to the third umpire. Which means Jadeja will be ruled out. Bit bizarre sequence of events. Wrong process, but right decision? If a West Indies fielder appealed when the direct hit was effected, there is still a justification for going up to the third umpire, even if late in the proceedings. But is it okay to go up after having seen the replay? That's one for the law mandarins to figure out.
nicely struck, too short, outside off, punched through cover
well disguised slower bouncer that fools the batsman, who is way too early into the pull shot
length ball outside off, chopped to short third man
yorker length outside off, swipes at it, wanted to go in the direction of cover but takes a thickish edge to short third man
slower ball on a length, too far down leg. Wide
shot!. Full ball tailing into him, doesn't have too much room, but the power he generates is enormous, and he punch-drives tthis through midwicket
length ball, swipes across the line to deep midwicket
normal pace bouncer that flies through, past his attempted wild slog
back of a length on middle and leg, pulled to midwicket
length ball on the stumps, he's moving across and bunts it square to give the strike to Dube
full outside off, Dube uses his power to drive this over extra cover. But Pollard's at wide long-off and runs across to tumble and save the ball

length ball on the stumps, Dube clears his front leg and swipes across the line. Doesn't get hold of it. Slower ball that stuck in the pitch and he gets more height than distance, holes out to long-off

full toss on off, smears it from deep within his crease but straight to Cottrell at deep square leg. Chahar thinks that was above waist height and is looking displeased it wasn't called. they belatedly go up to the third umpire who confirms, it was above the waist. Chahar survives.
well bowled, going across him and on a yorker length and he misses it. But they take the bye, even though it's gone to the keeper
leg cutter on leg stump, mistimes his pull to deep midwicket but gets enough on it to get a couple
yorker outside off, he was moving across, drives it to extra cover and they'll end only with a single
full, swings in towards off stump, driven to mid-off

back of a length, close to off stump, swings away late and Hope ends up getting beaten on the inside edge while trying to defend. Was he playing for more swing than there was? Huge gap between bat and body
another outswinger outside off, a little fuller, left alone
back of a length, a bit of shape away from the right-hander, punched into the point region
length ball close to off stump, gets forward and defends towards backward point
length ball outside off, a bit of outswing again, left alone
beauty. Late outswing in the channel outside off, from a good length. No footwork from Ambris, just defends from the crease and gets beaten by a long way
another outswinger on a good length close to off stump, this time Ambris gets a bit of a stride towards the ball and defends to cover point
length ball on middle stump, and that's superb timing, clipped away through the vacant square leg region, leaving fine leg far too much work to do
shifts back to the outside-off line, a little wider than the first few balls. Quite full, left alone

lovely shot again. This wasn't too straight - it was a length ball on off stump, but Shami doesn't get as much outswing on this occasion, and Ambris times his flick beautifully to beat midwicket diving to his right
length ball outside off, a bit of late away movement, left alone

back of a length outside off. Decent amount of width for the back-foot punch that Hope is attempting, but the ball stops on the pitch, and he ends up playing too early and hitting it back to the bowler rather than through the covers
big outswing from outside off, fullish length. Left alone
length ball, fifth-stump line, gentle outswing, left alone
back of a length, closer to off stump, punched to mid-on
full on off stump, drives firmly but can't beat Kohli, who moves quickly to his left from mid-off to cut it off
full, a little further outside off, driven between extra-cover and mid-off, and Kohli chases back and keeps it down to two
fullish, close to off stump, shows the full face for a push to the left of mid-on
ooh. Outswing from a leg-stump line. Squares up Hope, who plays slightly across the line, looking for midwicket, and ends up playing it back to the bowler off the outside half of the bat
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to play that to mid-on with a turn of his wrists
back of a length on off stump, blocked to mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend to point

big appeal for lbw, and it's given. Ambris doesn't review. Length ball angling into the stumps, and Ambris looks to flick. He was playing for outswing, I think - a dangerous thing to do if you're playing across the line like that - and the ball keeps going with the angle instead and brushes front pad before hitting his back pad. Hitting middle and leg, according to ball-tracking. No front-foot stride at all from Ambris
full, slanting across into the fifth-stump channel, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, punched to cover
length ball slanting across into a wide-ish line, looks like the slower offcutter. Hetmyer has a poke at it, with an open face, and edges it on the bounce to slip
fullish on off stump, defended to backward point
another offcutter, this time on a stump-to-stump line, clipped towards mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, stands tall and chops to backward point

ooh, lucky. Back of a length, angling in in the channel outside off. Hetmyer plants forward and looks to slash it away, but the inward angle denies him room. There's extra bounce too, and the thick edge flies over the fielder at slip
back of a length, close to off stump, chopped down into the point region
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
another edged four. Bouncer, skiddy one that climbs towards Hetmyer's left shoulder. Goes for the hook and top-edges high over the keeper's head
length ball close to off stump, gets forward for a push towards mid-on. Didn't quite middle it, and that gives him the time to take a quick single
full, angling in towards middle and leg, slower ball. Looks to clip it square, ends up playing it into the short fine leg region off inside edge and then pad

shot. Length ball, fourth-stump line, nothing wrong with the ball, but Hope steps forward and drives on the up, with a turn of the wrists on top of the bounce to find the gap between cover point and extra-cover
shortish outside off, and the ball stops on Hope as he shapes to cut, ends up dragging it down to mid-off
fullish slower one on off stump, clipped towards mid-on
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, punched towards mid-off
back of a length, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, clipped to midwicket
lovely delivery, perfect length and angling in, homing in on the top of off. Stays in the crease and blocks towards mid-on
fullish outside off, doesn't quite time his drive and it dribbles out towards extra-cover

fullish, angling in towards off stump, gets forward for a push back towards the bowler. They've gone upstairs for a belated run-out appeal, after Shami flings a direct hit at the batsman's end. He's well in, though
skiddy bouncer over off and middle, and Hope has to duck very low to get under it
back of a length close to off stump, punched to extra-cover
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler, and both new-ball bowlers have now bowled maidens
length ball spins from leg to middle, goes back and whips towards deep midwicket
tossed up slow and full, on middle stump, gets forward and almost yorks himself while defending
ooh, massive turn. Dangled up slow, close to off stump, and Hetmyer stretches out to defend. Then it dips and rips and beats his outside edge by a long way
full on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
loopy wrong'un on leg stump. Picks it and defends inside-out towards mid-off
tossed up on off stump, clipped to long-on
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to dab to backward point
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, stabbed to cover point
back of a length on off stump, sits up nicely, and Hetmyer clears his front leg and pulls over the wide mid-on region
back of a length, slants it wider, slapped to backward point
fullish, slanting across to off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up, floating across the right-hander and pitching outside off stump. Clipped with the turn to long-on
flighted ball, full and close to off stump, driven to long-on
dropped. Dangled up very full outside off, and Hope goes for the cover drive. Thick edge, and Rohit, flying to his left at slip, can't hold on to this difficult one-hander
length ball turning from middle to off, gets forward to block
tossed up, drifts outside leg and spins back in. Looks to sweep, misses, and the keeper misses it too. If it had turned a little more, he could have been bowled round his legs
slow flight close to off stump. Looks for the cover drive but plays too early, bottom hand coming into play. Ends up inside-edging into the turf by his feet
full on off stump, driven to long-on
length ball on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length, angling into the pads, clipped to the left of deep square leg
full and too straight, and Hope flicks it away, in the air, towards the vacant midwicket boundary
back of a length, on leg stump, clipped to the left of the diving short fine leg, and deep square leg runs round to cover
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to guide it to third man
lovely delivery. Floated up across the right-hander to pitch outside off, and it dips on Hope as he reaches out to drive through cover. It's the wrong'un too, and it beats his outside edge
tossed up wide of off, driven to cover point
another googly, spinning away from off stump. Stretches out to block into the covers
this is the stock ball, spinning in from outside off. Big stretch again from Hope, to defend, and the ball rolls into the square leg region off the inside edge
shortish outside off, stabbed away to deep point
tossed up slow on off stump and Hetmyer drags a big drive down to long-on, all along the ground

starts with a short, wide one. Uncharacteristic, because he usually attacks the stumps from that angle. Hetmyer slaps it away to the point boundary, and the sweeper is too far in front of square to be able to cut it off
shortish, closer to off, slapped to sweeper cover

full on off stump, clipped to the right of midwicket, and they set off for a confused single. A stutter in between, and Kohli dives, stops it, and throws at the keeper's end, but it's too far from the keeper to create a run-out chance. Could have been close, because Hetmyer was a little late getting going
shot., This wasn't as wide as the first ball. Instead, he uses the depth of the crease, and waits on the ball before cutting it away past backward point
tossed up wide of off, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket

shot. Read the length beautifully. Dangled up slow on off stump, and he knows he's hitting against the turn, but he judges the length well, knows it's within reach of his swing, and he slog-sweeps it mightily over the midwicket boundary
back of a length close to off stump, goes back to try and force it past backward point, but Rahul dives to his right to make a good stop
back of a length, spins away further than the previous ball. Can free his arms and punch to sweeper cover
back of a length, spins from off to leg, and he goes back to work it to deep backward square leg

ooh, nearly does him with the googly! The length was right for Hetmyer's cut, but he doesn't pick the wrong'un, and he just about manages to jam down in time and get some glove on it, onto his thigh pad
length ball on off stump, driven to long-on
flat length ball on middle and off, gets forward to clip with the turn through square leg
flat and full outside off, gets forward to jab into the covers
length ball speared in with a low-ish arm. Looks for the cover drive but only manages to hit it off the inside half of the bat, towards extra-cover
a touch shorter on off stump, goes back to work it into the midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to clip to midwicket
shortish outside off, chopped to backward point
tossed up on leg stump, the line possibly telegraphs the googly. Hetmyer reverse-sweeps to backward point. Too full for him to get a full extension of his arms and put any real power on it
back of a length on off stump, goes back and defends with the turn to midwicket
length ball spinning from leg to off, gets forward to defend into the covers
nicely bowled. Another wrong-un, pitching on middle and off and spinning further away. A little quicker, so Hope is hurried into his defensive push back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up slow on off stump, driven past the stumps at the other end to long-off
too full, tossed up on off, driven along the ground to deep cover with a flourish of the bat
too short, he rocks back and smears a pull to long-on's left
tossed up on a good length outside off, draws him on the front foot to defend
length ball on middle and leg, spinning across him, whipped to the bowler's right
skids through quicker and he gets his bat down in time to defend it near his feet
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards mid-off on the front foot
slower ball, back of a length outside off, he wanted to stroke it through cover but is a bit early so ends up bunting it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
slower ball, digs it short of a length, Hetmyer fetches the pull from outside off to deep midwicket
hung in the air a while! He was early into the push forward and it pops up, but drops short of Kohli at short cover
length ball on the stumps, slaps it down to deep midwicket
back of a length, pace off outside off. That's going to be Chahar's plan to Hetmyer, with three men on the legside boundary. This time the batsman whips it to deep midwicket along the ground
length on the stumps, punched to extra cover
back of a length but close to off stump, he goes back and uses wrists to whip this to long-on
Chahar misfields at short fine leg. Drifts down leg and is tickled fine. Chahar is rushing in as they take a quick single and doesn't collect, resulting in an extra run
length outside off, driven to long-off
some turn for Jadeja, pitches outside off and turns into him sharply. He was looking to give himself room but ends up being a bit cramped and hits it back down the pitch
short, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket. Not timed perfectly
fuller, punched on the front foot to long-off
length ball, strays on the pads, tucked to deep square leg
short ball outside off to Hetmyer yet again. He goes for the hook, but doesn't time it and it lands near the edge of the circle. The fielders are back on the boundary
length on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
digs it in short to Hope also now, who also goes for the pull. Gets it to deep midwicket, though without any great timing
back of a length, coming into him on off, he stays back and swipes across the line to long-on. Fifty for Hetmyer.
slower short ball outside off again, and he he bottom edges an attempted pull onto boot. He's lucky it didn't roll back and disturb the stumps
marginally short outside off, goes back and punches through extra cover
length ball closer to off stump, he shuffles across and plays it to mid-on with a straight bat
short outside off, clears his front leg and slaps it hard to long-off
tossed up, full on middle, he makes room and drives inside out to long-off
dismissed. Dragged short again by Jadeja, and this time Hetmyer connects nicely. Goes back and slaps a pull shot over long-on
and once again! This time he goes deep and smacks it over deep midwicket. Are the IPL scouts watching?
length ball in the channel, opens the face to run it down to third man
good length on leg stump, sticks in the pitch a bit, and Hetmyer ends up pushing it back to the bowler
angles this across him on a fullish length outside off. He mis-times the slap to mid-off
super shot. This has been hit between long-on and deep midwicket and managed to beat them both by how well he hit it. Too short from Dube, and he rocks back to pull this powerful and flat.
length ball, going across him, plays it on the front foot to extra cover
length ball on the stumps, goes deep in his crease and flicks it off his pads to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, defended into the offside
tossed up, drifts down the pads, turns it round the corner on the front foot

lovely shot. Hetmyer's winning this battle handily at the moment. This was quicker on a length outside off - because he couldn't afford to be short after those sixes - and Hetmyer goes back and cuts it past backward point
fuller on off, worked off the front foot
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and guides it to point
quicker one, length ball nipping into him, he flicks it off his pads to fine leg

length ball outside off and Hetmyer is just so beautifully balanced as he cuts this through point. It didn't look like he had the room to really free his arms but powerful forearms and great timing mean it just races to the boundary
length outside off, punched to mid-off
length outside off, pushed through extra cover
length ball, jags back into him, hits him high on the thigh pad. He misses the flick, but they get a leg-bye with the ball rolling through backward square leg
clips a fuller ball to wide long-on
goes back and flicks it off his pads to deep square leg

inside edge goes for a boundary. Came off the glove in fact. Good ball on a length and jagging back in, the bounce caught him by surprise as he was coming forward. Clips his glove and goes to fine leg
fuller outside off, driven to the man on the cover boundary
back of a length on leg, hint of movement away, steered to point

yorker on off, and he jams his bat down in time to push it to mid-off. Overthrows and they get an extra run. The fielder, let loose a throw that nobody could collect at the bowler's end. Pant had to dive to his right to stop the ball but couldn't gather cleanly
whoa, what a hit!. Too short and he rocks back to absolutely smoke it over deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, guides it to point
appeal for a stumping. Beautifully bowled by Jadeja, drawing him forward and spinning it past, but Hope kept his foot grounded behind the crease, so he's safe.
length outside off, stays back and drives through cover
quicker one, hurried onto him. He was going deep in his crease, ends up mistiming the pull to mid-on
length outside off, punched to mid-on
quicker one on a length outside off, spinning into him, pushed back to the bowler
length outside off, pushed to mid-on. There is a single there, though would have required quick running. He doesn't take it.
fuller outside off, driven back off the toe end, Shami fields on his follow through
yorker length almost, tailing into him a bit, driven to extra cover
slower bouncer outside off, controls the pull shot, keeps it down and doesn't hit it hard, to deep square leg. They jog through for a single
fuller outside off, driven to mid-off and he takes a brisk single. So he's moving a bit better now, apparently
another short ball outside off, normal pace, but Hope comfortably pulls this to deep midwicket
fuller outside off, drives the low full toss to long-on
tossed up wide of off stump, he reaches for it and strokes it through cover
tossed up on the stumps, comes on the front foot and flicks it past midwicket
length ball outside off, breaks sharply away further, and makes Hetmyer reach for it, and slap it through the offside
tossed up on the stumps, comes on the front foot and gets to the pitch, clips to long-on

brilliant diving stop by Pandey at the point boundary. But this was an equally brilliant shot too. Kuldeep's been bowling it wide of off and spinning it away. Hetmyer's caught on and he waits for this, gets into position nicely by transferring weight across and cutting it
fuller on the stumps, lunges out to defend
length ball on the stumps, he takes a big stride and smothers it
length ball, he went back to this one, and wasn't in perfect position to play it, ends up jabbing it down
tossed up outside off, driven by opening the bat face, to point
tries to run it down, misses it and it rolls near him off the thigh pad
driven firmly but straight to point
length ball on the pads, tucked past midwicket. Raises his fifty but it's taken him 92 balls.
tossed up, he takes a step down and whips it to deep midwicket on the full
tossed up on a length outside off, he can't get to the pitch despite a big stride and mistimes the drive to mid-off
drifts down leg, tries to turn it but misses. It flicks the pad and goes fine. Dube runs to his right and makes a tumbling stop at the fine leg boundary
tossed up on the stumps, clipped off his toes while coming forward, to midwicket
length ball outside off, skids on a bit, he shuffles across and defends from the crease
fuller on the stumps, driven to long-off
length ball outside off, comes on the front foot and taps it softly on the offside to get off strike.
length ball on off, patted down to fine leg with a horizintal bat
length on the stumps, defended towards mid-off
goes back to this one and tucks it off his pads to square leg
fuller on the pads, comes on the front foot and clips it through square leg to move to 99
marginally short outside off, slapped through cover on the front foot
wide of off stump, launches into a drive but straight to the cover fielder. Stays on 99.
tossed up on off, gives himself room and drives to wide long-off
tossed up on off, comes on the front foot and drives to long-on to raise his fifth ODI century. What a fantastic innings it's been, even after the slight slowdown post that cramps attack.
tossed up on the stumps, driven to long-on off his toes
slightly short outside off, spinning away from him, stays back and cuts
shuffles across but is cramped for room with Kuldeep bowling it in the channel, and he ends up patting to midwicket
goes back and cuts this hard, but can't beat cover
back of a length, turns in towards middle stump, goes on the back foot to work it through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven firmly but Kohli stops it with a dive to his right at extra-cover
flat, speared into the pitch. Stops on Hope, who looks to punch off the back foot, and it nearly carries back to Jadeja diving to his left
flat length ball on middle stump, goes on the back foot and is hurried into a defensive prod back to the bowler
slower now, on off stump, stretches out to block to extra-cover
drifts onto the pads, and Hope tucks it fine of short fine leg

lucky. Full, angling in towards off stump. Looks to clear his front leg and drive over mid-off, and gets a thick edge that runs away to the third man boundary. Short third man is too square to cut it off
slower bouncer outside off. Too early on the pull and he ends up hitting it back to the bowler
another slower bouncer, a little wider outside off. Hetmyer swings and misses thanks to the loopy bounce, looking for the pull

dropped. Iyer has put down a straightforward chance here. Short, angling into off stump. Sits up, but loses a bit of pace off the pitch, and Hetmyer can't get this flat-bat hit to carry over long-on as he might have expected. The fielder at long-on, Iyer, dives forward, and can't wrap his hands around the low chance a few inches off the ground
back of a length, a bit of width, opens his bat face and steers it between short third man and backward point
back of a length outside off, steps forward and drives on the up to deep point
fullish, speared in towards middle and leg, driven inside-out to extra-cover
full again, angling into the stumps, driven to long-off
back of a length, spins in sharply to cramp Hetmyer on the pull. Plays a short-arm jab to midwicket
no troubles with this delivery. Too short from Jadeja, and he rocks back and pulls with the turn, up and over the wide long-on boundary
fuller now, outside off, and Hetmyer has deposited this onto the roof! Drops onto his back knee and slog-sweeps waaaay over long-on and onto the roof of the old Anna Pavilion
short, a bit of width, chopped to backward point
yikes. Short and wide, and Hope slaps it away, straight to the fielder at point, Rahul, who fumbles and allows the ball to slip between his legs
full on off stump, driven firmly, looking for mid-off, and Kohli runs quickly to his right from extra-cover to intercept
back of a length outside off, slashes hard and gets an outside edge that runs down to third man
in the blockhole on off and middle, and he jams his bat down quickly to keep it out
full, angling into off stump, and Hetmyer drives down the ground, to the right of long-on
slower bouncer, gets it up around Hetmyer's back shoulder, and he controls his pull well, along the ground to deep square leg
full, angling across to off stump. Driven firmly but can't beat extra-cover
full again, a little further outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length, angling into middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
short on off stump, sits up invitingly, and Hetmyer plants his front leg away towards the leg side to make swinging room, and launches it flat over wide long-on
low full-toss now, on off stump, and he drives punchily to the left of extra-cover, leaving long-off no chance
full now, clipped to deep midwicket

wow. That's full and angling into off stump. Not the full length that allows you to get forward, but the near-yorker length that doesn't, in theory, give you room to free your arms. But he shifts his weight back, Lara-style, and drills it hard to beat extra-cover to his left and long-off to his right
full, on the stumps now, clipped to long-on
length ball angling into off stump. Stays back, opens his bat face, and dabs to third man

gone. Short now, climbs to shoulder height, and this time he can't clear the rope with his pull. Has to work against the over-the-wicket angle, and ends up picking out Iyer on the midwicket boundary. Generous applause from the Chennai crowd as Hetmyer walks back to the dressing room
length ball close to off stump, punched towards mid-off
full, close to off stump, opens his bat face to squeeze it out to third man
tossed up on middle stump. Can't get to the pitch of it to flick through midwicket, rolls to short fine leg off the inner half of the bat
quicker now, clipped to the left of short fine leg and they think of a single but decide against it

brilliant. Wrong'un, starting from off stump and spinning away further. Doesn't pick it. Presses forward to push into the covers and it slips past his outside edge. They go upstairs to check for a stumping but he's fine

big spin the other way now. The length has been brilliant right through the over, drawing Hope forward but never allowing him to get to the pitch. Tries to flick it and it spins past his inside edge and hits his front pad. Missing leg
flatter now, spins down the leg side as Hope looks to shuffle and work it leg side
the fullest ball of the over, on off stump, stretches out to drive to long-off
tossed up outside off. Looks to sweep but only manages to hit it to short fine leg off the bottom edge
back of a length on off stump. Looks to stay leg-side of the ball and dab it past point, but he can't find his placement
length ball close to off stump, and once again Hope dabs straight to point in an attempt to find a single
bouncer now, rising over leg stump. Hope ducks low to evade it

short outside off, only gets up to chest height and sat up nicely. A welcome release of pressure for Hope, who pulls to beat midwicket to his right. Deep square leg is behind square, so there's no way he can cut it off
length ball outside off, driven powerfully but straight to deep point
short again, doesn't get up as much as Pooran expects, and he plays a controlled flick-pull, from in front of his chest, to deep backward square leg
tossed up outside off, can't beat point with his sliced drive
tossed up nicely again, a little closer to off stump. Looks to sweep and misses, and the ball turns away sharply
this is a difficult pitch for a new batsman. Sharp turn again, from off stump. Should have been on the front foot. Looks to make room and is beaten by a long way, jabbing at the ball
a bit slower, similar line, swept along the ground to deep square leg
beauty. Flatter wrong'un, on off stump, and Hope is stuck to the crease, turned inside-out in defence as his outside edge is beaten
quickish again, spinning down leg. Can't put bat to ball as he tries to work it off his thigh pad

big appeal for lbw, but is that turning too much? Not given by umpire Shaun George, and India have reviewed. Classic left-arm wristspinner's delivery. Floating across the right-hander, dipping on him, pitching outside off, and ripping back in to beat the inside edge of the forward defensive. Impact is in line with off stump, but, as I suspected, it's turning too much and missing leg stump, according to ball-tracking. Pretty big stride too
length ball slanting away from off stump. Not full enough to drive through cover, and the ball beats his outside edge
short, gets up to waist height on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short, wide, slapped to deep point
full on middle and off, clipped to long-on
full, angling across to off stump. A little early on the drive, and he plays it back to the bowler rather than through mid-off as intended
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that to long-on
slower ball, back of a length, angling into off stump. Looks to work it with the angle and misses. Ricochets off the pads into the backward point region
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
slower short ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
short, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, pulled firmly to deep midwicket
back of a length, wide of off. Looks to cut off the front foot and ends up bottom-edging towards the keeper
full on off stump, pushed towards mid-off

shot. Fantastic shot at a crucial time. Short, angling into the ribcage, and he hops across and whips it over short fine leg. Maybe the short ball wasn't the ideal one to bowl with fine leg in the circle, but he still had to play a really good shot to exploit the field
in the blockhole on off stump, opens his bat face and steers to deep point
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, worked to deep square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
shortish, angling across to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on, kind of toe-ended
fullish on off stump. Looks to drive to the left of extra-cover, maybe, but the ball stops on him and ends up rolling to the right of the fielder, off the inner half of the bat
steps out and Dube responds with a slower short ball. Swivels too early into his pull, and he ends up bottom-edging into the short third man region
length ball, angling across to off stump, and the stadium goes silent as Pooran makes a bit of room and flat-bats it crisply to the right of the diving extra-cover fielder
slower length ball on off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently into the off side
offcutter, nips in sharply towards off stump as Hope initially shapes to push into the covers. Has to adjust and work it through square leg instead
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
slower ball, back of a length close to off stump. Lets it come on and dabs gently into the point region
fullish on off stump, driven firmly and straight to extra-cover

bang. Back of a length, angling into the stumps, and it's the knuckle ball. Hope slides away to the leg side to make himself room, holds his shape beautifully, and flat-bats it hard, back over the bowler's head, and over the boundary as well. Super shot

and there's the hundred. It's been a struggle, but he's hung in there, fought the conditions and his own lack of fluency, and he's now earning the rewards. Short from Chahar, and he pulls it away to the right of midwicket
short ball on off stump, mistimes his pull to midwicket
short on off stump, sits up nicely at shoulder height, at Dube's pace, and Pooran swats it away firmly to beat deep square leg to his right
length ball, a bit of width, slapped to sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full outside off, and mid-off is up in the circle. Frees his arms and lofts it flat over the fielder's head
short, sits up at waist height, and Pooran wins it with another cracking stroke, a flat pull to the left of midwicket. What a victory for West Indies
